CatDescriptText: Jack Tuff, college student, 2225 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "I don't think so. I think that most people will see that the hazard is much worse than increased taxation.  I don't think that they will disapprove as they did in the past, if the Government makes a good effort to present the seriousness of the school situation.  If anything does happen, like a fire or some other tragedy, the people are going to hold the Government responsible.  Therefore, the people should must be prepared to pay for the safety of the children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jack Tuff, wearing button down herringbone coat with collar and lapels, dark plaid button down collared shirt, and plaid cap, standing in front of wood paneled wall
